pageContext.claim: “100,000 was the minimum we thought that we could get to, and we -- we will be lower than that number.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. would surpass 100,000 recorded deaths from covid-19 months weeks later. When Trump made these remarks on April 18, the U.S. had nearly 33,000 deaths and experts predicted the total would keep rising. So there was little to no scientific basis for Trump's prediction.
